N. bidentatum sparsum Gruber & Martens, 1968

tp:treatment-sec.p: Typical male hybrids with elongated Ch-Apo with knee-like flexion of frontal margin, and equidistant triangular upper portion, and club-shaped, but relatively thin Pa-Fe, with tubercle tightly in front of the first spine of four simple, equidistant ventral spines in distal Pa-Fe half, either pointed or almost without the tip.
